p: Patch-clamp analysis (Fig. 8.16) revealed a single-channel conductance of about 20–30 pS. The channel is selectively permeable for monovalent cations with highest selectivity for K +. As a result of 3a channel activity the membrane potential will depolarize, which results in Ca 2+ channel activation. The increase in intracellular Ca 2+ activity then facilitates the exocytotic release of viruses from the host cell (Lu et al. 2006).
